Module Simulator
Package kin.dyn

Class ConnectionPoint

java.lang.Object
kin.dyn.ConnectionPoint
public final class ConnectionPoint
extends java.lang.Object
A ConnectionPoint mounts a component to a greater part, e.g. a leg to body. The ConnectionPoint specifies the location where the component should be attached in local coordinates of the greater part. In addition, the connected part may be turned.

    • ConnectionPoint

      public ConnectionPoint​(RotoTranslation rotoTranslationLocal, TailSidePartModel tailSidePartModel)
      Create a ConnectionPoint by a roto-translation and static tail-side-part.
      Parameters:
      rotoTranslationLocal - local roto-translation – may be null, if currently not known
      tailSidePartModel - static tail-side-part

    • ConnectionPoint

      public ConnectionPoint​(ConnectionPoint otherConnectionPoint)
      Copy constructor. Note that the fix-side and tail-side part references are not copied.
      Parameters:
      otherConnectionPoint - other connection point

    • dump

      public void dump()
      Dump the state to System.out.

    • rotoTranslationLocalSymbolic

      public java.lang.String rotoTranslationLocalSymbolic()
      Get a string that describes the local roto-translation in a symbolic manner. This means, if the roto-translation depends on a motor setting (e.g. servo angle), this angle is integrated as variable into the string.
      Important: For passive elements this method only shows the current values in a non-symbolic manner, as the local roto-translation cannot easily be represented.
      Returns:
      symbolic string

    • defineTranslationLocalSymbolicVariable

      public void defineTranslationLocalSymbolicVariable​(int type, java.lang.String variable, double value)
      Define the symbolic type of the local roto-translation. This is used to dump a useful expression with rotoTranslationLocalSymbolic().
      Parameters:
      type - type of roto-translation: 0: servo, 1: linear
      variable - symbolic variable (e.g. servo angle) on which the roto-translation depends
      value - value of the symbolic variable
